required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Extension Study to Evaluate the Long-Term Outcomes of Pediatric Patients Who Received Treatment for Retinopathy of Prematurity in the VGFTe-ROP-1920 Study (Acronym: Butterfleye Next)
clinical_study.official_title: An Extension Study to Evaluate the Long-Term Outcomes of Patients Who Received Treatment for Retinopathy of Prematurity in the VGFTe-ROP-1920 Study

brief_summary.textblock:
Primary objectives of the study are:
- To evaluate binocular visual acuity at the end of this study in patients included from the VGFTe-ROP-1920 study, for treatment of Retinopathy of Prematurity (ROP).
- To evaluate long-term safety outcomes in patients included from the VGFTe-ROP-1920 study, for treatment of ROP.
Secondary objectives of the study are:
- To describe visual function in patients included from the VGFTe-ROP-1920 study, for treatment of ROP.
- To describe overall development in patients included from the VGFTe-ROP-1920 study, for treatment of ROP.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Patients with Adverse Events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 5 years of chronological age

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Patients with Serious Adverse Events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 5 years of chronological age

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients developing unfavorable ocular structural outcome
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 years of chronological age, 5 years of chronological age
secondary_outcome.description: Unfavorable ocular structural outcome: retinal detachment, macular dragging, macular fold, retrolental opacity

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 year of chronological age, 5 years of chronological age

secondary_outcome.measure: Refractive spherical equivalent in each eye
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 years of chronological age, 5 years of chronological age

secondary_outcome.description: The Bayley Scales of Infant and Toddler Development, Third Edition (BSID-III) is a standard series of tests that will assess the development of children in 3 areas: cognition, language, and motor skills. This is a mandatory assessment to be performed at 2 years of age.

The Wechsler Preschool and Primary Scale of Intelligence, Fourth Edition (WPPSI-IV) is designed to assess development of older children and is recommended to be performed at 3, 4 and 5 years of age. The assessment at 5 years of age is mandatory. In cases where the WPSSI-IV cannot be used, the Differential Ability Scales II (DAS-II) may be used as an alternative.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 years of chronological age, 5 years of chronological age
secondary_outcome.description: The Vineland Adaptive Behavior Scales, Second Edition (VABS-II) Expanded Interview will be included, which includes 4 areas: Communication, Daily Living skills, Socialization and Motor Skills. The assessments at 2 years and 5 years of age are mandatory.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with recurrence of ROP
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 years of chronological age, 5 years of chronological age

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients requiring treatment for ROP

arm_group.description: Retinopathy of prematurity (ROP) who were treated with aflibercept and/or laser photocoagulation in study VGFTe-ROP-1920.

intervention.description: No study treatment will be administered in this study

study_pop.textblock: All patients who were treated in the VGFTe-ROP-1920 study are eligible for enrollment into this follow-up study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patient was treated in study VGFTe-ROP-1920
2. Age <13 months of chronological age
3. Signed informed consent from parent(s)/legal guardian(s), which includes compliance with the requirements and restrictions listed in the informed consent form (ICF) and in this protocol
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patient has a condition preventing participation in the study, or performance of study procedures
NOTE: Other Inclusion/Exclusion criteria may apply

patient_data.ipd_description: All Individual Patient Data (IPD) that underlie publicly available results will be considered for sharing
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Individual anonymized participant data will be considered for sharing once the indication has been approved by a regulatory body, if there is legal authority to share the data and there is not a reasonable likelihood of participant re-identification.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Qualified researchers may request access to anonymized patient level data or aggregate study data when Regeneron has received marketing authorization from major health authorities (e.g., FDA, European Medicines Agency (EMA), Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices Agency (PMDA), etc) for the product and indication, has the legal authority to share the data, and has made the study results publicly available (eg, scientific publication, scientific conference, clinical trial registry).
